<jobs>
    <job>
        <title><![CDATA[Channel Account Executive]]></title>
        <description><![CDATA[
  

  

  

  
Overview
  

  

  

  
 (ISC)² ® is the world’s largest nonprofit membership association of certified cybersecurity professionals. We’re committed to helping our members learn, grow and thrive by providing world-class cybersecurity qualifications, professional development and engagement opportunities that inspire a safe and secure cyber world. With a membership more than 168,000 strong, we empower professionals who touch every aspect of information security. 
  

  

  

  
Position Summary
  

  

  

  
 The Channel Account Executive  is responsible for the development, execution and ongoing management of programs and activities with (ISC)2Official Training Providers and prospective partners that generate demand of (ISC)² training, education and certification products. Your ability to build positive working relationships with channel partners to maximize sales within your partner base and prospect to obtain new partners is essential to your success in this role.This person will report to the Manager, Global Channel Partner Sales.  You will work closely with our other departments including education, marketing, and finance.  
  

  

  

  
Responsibilities
  

  

  

  

  
+  Recruit new partners for sales growth and manage existing partners 
  

  
+  Coordinate with partners to identify key sales opportunities to generate revenue 
  

  
+  Enable channel partners through training on the business value and ROI of (ISC)² products 
  

  
+  Works closely with the (ISC)²  marketing teams to develop, implement, and manage marketing and call campaign programs to increase business development through channel partners 
  

  
+  Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction with current partners and manage tasks to successful completion 
  

  
+  Prepare and give presentations to key, influential decision makers within current and potential channel and academic partners. 
  

  
+  Recruit and enable focused channel partners especially in verticals and markets we are not currently servicing today. 
  

  
+  Prepare and deliver reports to management on quarterly basis 
  

  
+  Manage daily sales activities with partners to achieve revenue growth 
  

  
+  Develop partner specific sales and marketing plans to increast marketing and selling efforts 
  

  
+  Prepare and submit monthly forecasting reports to management 
  

  
+  Fiscal responsibility with regards to expense management 
  

  
+  Works with internal team members to make sure communications are effective and efficient between (ISC)² and our channel partners. 
  

  
+  In-depth knowledge of (ISC)² certification and training programs and other supporting products and services 
  

  
+  Manage sales activities and maintain sales records and reports 
  

  
+  Miscellaneous duties, as assigned. 
  

  

  

  

  
Qualifications
  

  

  

  

  
+  University degree preferred; will consider relevant work experience in lieu of a degree. 
  

  
+  Previous experience in IT training industry using consultative selling 
  

  
+  5 years of successful channel management experience. 
  

  
+  Proficient in Microsoft Office. 
  

  
+  Salesforce experience preferred. 
  

  
+  Knowledge of the cybersecurity certification market preferred 
  

  
+  Experience working in a channel with cybersecurity providers preferred 
  

  

  
 Skills/Competencies: 
  

  

  
+  Ability to demonstrate and support the 5 Company Core Values:  Integrity, Excellence, Unity, Accountability, Agility 
  

  
+  Previous experience managing channel partners or working in a cybersecurity channel 
  

  
+  Self-starter who provides creative and pragmatic solutions to business issues and problems 
  

  
+  A positive, can-do attitude, sense of urgency, energy and enthusiasm – a true team player 
  

  
+  Professionalism with a high degree of business savvy and strong demonstration of intellect, drive, and executive presence 
  

  
+  Willingness to do what it takes to meet channel partner goals while maintaining the absolute highest standards in terms of honesty, integrity and business ethics. 
  

  
+  Strong interpersonal skills with channel partners, and our internal team members alike, exhibiting focus and drive for business building and working collaboratively with (ISC)² employees to grow the business 
  

  
+  Superior organizational and planning skills with excellent written and oral/presentation skills 
  

  
+  High sense of urgency.  
  

  

  
 Physical & Mental: 
  

  

  
+  Work extended hours, when necessary 
  

  
+  50% travel required 
  

  
+  Work in an office environment using dual monitor computer screens 
  

  
+  Sitting for extended periods 
  

  

  
 #LI-REMOTE 
  

  
 
  

  

  

  
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
  

  

  

  
 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic as protected by applicable law. 
  

  
 Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. 
  

  

  

  

  

  

  
 
  

  
 
  

  
 
  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  
 
  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  
Job LocationsUS-Remote
  
Posted Date2 days ago(4/12/2022 11:11 AM)
  

  
Job ID 2022-1345 
  

  
# of Openings 1 
  

  
Category Sales

    <job>
        <title><![CDATA[Sr. Marketing Manager, Professional Development]]></title>
        <description><![CDATA[
  

  

  

  
Overview
  

  

  

  
 (ISC)² ® is the world’s largest nonprofit membership association of certified cybersecurity professionals. We’re committed to helping our members learn, grow and thrive by providing world-class cybersecurity qualifications, professional development and engagement opportunities that inspire a safe and secure cyber world. With a membership more than 168,000 strong, we empower professionals who touch every aspect of information security. 
  

  

  

  
Position Summary
  

  

  

  
 We are on a journey of global growth at an important time in the Cybersecurity profession and are seeking a Sr. Marketing Manager, Professional Development to support a growing portfolio of professional development products and experiences available to (ISC)2members and non-members (e.g. students, candidates). The right person will have proven experience in developing, directing, and implementing marketing plans that drive progressive engagement across a variety of products, services and experiences globally. 
  

  

  

  
Responsibilities
  

  

  

  

  
+  In collaboration with global marketing leadership, d evelop, direct, and execute multiple, simultaneous integrated global marketing strategies and campaigns for multiple customer touchpoints along the journey towards — and after — certification, including student, candidate, post-certification that increase market penetration and capture new audiences. Specific focus on promoting the full spectrum of membership experience, including an expanding library of professional development engagement opportunities 
  

  
+  Strategic thinker who can develop and deliver brand, business, and marketing strategies informed and validated by relevant data and insights . Leverages data to drive analytics and reporting, refining strategies and execution across all channels and media 
  

  
+  Provides input and informs new product development and pricing – assessing market priorities, segmentation needs, investment levels, brand plans and strategic objectives. Produces new ideas, approaches or insights for marketing, commercial and experience-based topics 
  

  
+  Strong collaborator with internal stakeholders who understands product, service, experience value propositions and best positions them in a customized and personalized way to target audiences. Works collaboratively across multiple departments including Creative, Media, Events, Communications, Strategy, Education and Professional Development. 
  

  
+  Demonstrate personal and professional commitment to working collaboratively across the organization, to foster a spirit of creativity, and to striving for operational excellence in all areas of responsibility. 
  

  
+  Formulates and adheres to budgets and goals while working with key stakeholders to implement marketing programs across all media including, but not limited to digital marketing, email marketing, social, PPC, third party and co-marketing agreements, print, mailers, etc. 
  

  
+  Leverage business intelligence to improve performance as well as identify and reach new audiences for portfolio of products. Optimizes the CRM system to target, nurture, and convert prospective members (Prospects) to client members and move existing client members to higher value level through the expanded adoption of products and services 
  

  
+  Miscellaneous projects and duties as assigned. 
  

  

  

  

  
Qualifications
  

  

  

  

  
+  Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or related field 
  

  
+  10 years related experience in marketing. Membership or Association marketing experience preferred. 
  

  
+  Experienc
